Sec. 2-1793. Strategic Planning.
The Mayor shall develop a strategic plan to guide the ongoing and proposed activities of the County for a period of not less than five years. The strategic plan should take into consideration the collective aspirations of the community, as well as the views and suggestions of County elected officials and professional staff.
The County strategic plan shall be revised and updated periodically, at intervals of not more than five years, and shall be submitted by the Mayor to the Board of County Commissioners for ratification.
The Strategic Plan shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following components:
A broad, comprehensive statement of purpose for County government;
Medium- to long-range goals;
Priority outcomes relative to each major program area which departments are expected to achieve; and
Specific and measurable performance indicators, with corresponding performance targets, for each priority outcome.
The strategic plan shall serve as the framework for departmental business planning, the allocation of County resources and managerial accountability.
